author: Daisy Mowke
content: The Union Cabinet on Thursday approved the IndiaAI mission with an outlay of ₹10,371.92 crore for five years. The mission aims to establish a comprehensive ecosystem catalysing AI innovation through strategic programmes and partnerships across the public and private sectors. It will be implemented by 'IndiaAI' Independent Business Division under Digital India Corporation.
title: ₹10,372-crore IndiaAI mission approved by govt

author: Editor
content: In a new study, scientists led by Kent and the STFC Rutherford Appleton Laboratory have reported about the discovery of a new rare topological superconductor, LaPt3P. The superconductor was discovered through muon spin relaxation experiments and extensive theoretical analysis. They are exceptionally rare and are of tremendous value to the future industry of quantum computing.
title: A new rare topological superconductor discovered

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Apple has terminated a developer account of Fortnite maker Epic Games that was going to launch the Epic Games Store on iOS devices in the European Union. Apple cited past violations by Epic for terminating its Sweden AB developer account. "Competition is a fragile thing. Apple can crush it...by selectively blocking specific competitors like us," Epic's CEO Tim Sweeney said.
title: Apple terminates Fortnite maker Epic's Sweden developer account

author: Vivek
content: IBM has signed an MoU with the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) to enhance High Performance Computing (HPC) in India. The partnership aims to foster the growth of India's developer community by focusing on processor design, system design, firmware, and application development, including contributions to open-source initiatives.
title: IBM, C-DAC to enhance High Performance Computing (HPC) in India

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Elon Musk shared an edited picture of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman wearing an ID card that read 'ClosedAI', with a caption saying, "Fixed it". Musk recently sued OpenAI, accusing it of breaching its founding contract by pursuing profits. In another post, Musk said he will drop the lawsuit if OpenAI changes its name to ClosedAI.
title: Musk shares altered pic of Sam Altman with ID saying 'ClosedAI'

author: Bhana Neur
content: In a world where the echoes of gender bias still exist, the solar energy sector emerges as a beacon of change, challenging the long-standing notion that infrastructure is a man's domain. As we navigate through the 21st century, it's becoming increasingly clear that the future of energy and infrastructure is sustainable and green but also inclusive and diverse.
title: Women's Day: why infrastructure is not just a man's world

author: Rameez Reza
content: In Microsoft Excel, a formula manipulates a group of cell data to yield the intended result. Excel formulas perform basic calculations to the most complex mathematical operations. Excel also allows you to work with date and time variables and do numerous other operations like finding averages and percentages for a group of cells.
title: 25 most common Excel formulas & keyboard shortcuts

author: Debaroti Adhikary
content: One of Google's former software engineers has been arrested in US for allegedly stealing artificial intelligence trade secrets from the tech giant to secretly help two Chinese companies. Linwei Ding, a Chinese national, allegedly stole more than 500 confidential files. If convicted, he faces up to 10 years in prison and $250,000 in fines on each count.
title: Ex-Google engineer arrested in US for stealing AI secrets for Chinese firms

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by MakeMyTrip against Google. The travel booking company had accused Google's ads program of using its trademark 'MakeMyTrip' as a keyword to promote the website of its rival Booking.com. The apex court noted that users won't confuse Booking.com for MakeMyTrip.
title: SC rejects MakeMyTrip's trademark infringement suit against Google

author: Debaroti Adhikary
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) currently cannot replace core engineering discipline, said Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Mandi Director Laxmidhar Behera. Engineering colleges' curriculums need no change with the advent of AI because the new technologies cannot do research, he added. "ChatGPT is a good innovation but it is as dumb as possible," he further said.
title: ChatGPT is dumb, AI will have its own end: IIT Mandi Director
